TextView.android:text: The department is established in the year 2000 with an intake of 40 students. The present intake of department is 60 with total of 180 students studying in I, II, III and IV years. The department is equipped with all necessary infrastructure and laboratory facilities. Keeping in view of the Vision and Mission, the department is untiringly stepping towards the progress and achieving excellence in outcome base education. The department observes discipline among student community by imbibing good human qualities and moral, students are also motivated towards research oriented aspects. The department has well qualified, dedicated, expert faculty and supporting staff.

The department is recognized as Research Centre by Visvesvaraya Technological University Belagavi in the year 2013 and at present 14 research scholars are pursuing their Ph.D., Research centre put forward its activities and grabbed the AICTE research promotion schemes to carry out various projects.
The centre pillar of the department is its curricula and the faculty. The faculty and staff of the department made remarkable standings by involving themselves in academic activities like conducting various Workshops, Seminars and Industry Institute Interaction programs. The workshops and seminars are sponsored by TEQIP- II, TEQIP-III, ISTE, IETE and IE. The department made remarkable standings by joining its hand with other Electrical Engineering Branches in organizing “International Conference on Current Research and Applications in Electrical Science – 2016”. Some of the faculty of the department participated as resource persons for workshops and delivered their technical sessions in various Engineering, Diploma colleges and in professional societies,
The department curricula meet the industry requirements. The cutting edge technology labs namely R-programming lab, Data Mining with SPSS Modeler, IoT, Software Testing using Selenium, Python programming with UNIX, Web Designing with PHP, MySQL and JAVA Servlets represents the industry standards.
The department frequently organizes many student centric activities like Soft Skill Development programs, Quizzes, Plickers, Group Discussions and Extracurricular activities under the Students Association “Pheonix” . The department also publishes the yearly magazine “SPIRIT” and the semester wise newsletter “INSIGHT”.
The asset of the department is its Alumni. The department Alumni contribute their ideas and suggestions in framing curricula with respect to industry advancements. Alumni are spread across the globe and are well placed. Some of them are emerged as entrepreneurs.
The corner stone of the department is its Industry Institute Interaction Programs. The department has signed MoU with various industries that works like bench mark for the students and the faculty to get exposed to IT sector and current industry needs. It also promotes student placement.
The Training and Placement team of the department observes 360 degree evaluation of the students, and encourages them to involve in academic activities. Many students got placed in reputed industries both in private and public sectors.
To impart quality education and research in Information Technology to produce a competent, committed and goal oriented workforce to fulfil the needs of the local and global requirements.
The Department’s Mission is to advance knowledge in the Information and Computing Sciences by providing our students with the highest quality educational experience by
M1: Producing quality workforce with cutting edge technology.
M2: Engaging in innovative teaching learning, research and community service.
M3: Strengthening continuous interactions with alumni and industry and enable graduates to attain entrepreneurial qualities with life-long learning skills.
The program educational objectives of the B.E. in Information Science and Engineering program at PDA College of Engineering, Kalaburagi are to produce graduates who are able to:
PEO 1: Apply the principles of information and allied science, mathematics and scientific investigation to solve real world problems appropriate to the discipline.
PEO 2: Apply current industry accepted computing practices and emerging technologies to analyze, design, implement, and verify high quality IT-based solutions to real world problems.
PEO 3: Exhibit teamwork and effective communication skills.
PEO 4: Understand the ethical obligations, social impacts and apply their technical knowledge positively and appropriately in the course of career and professional journey.
PEO 5: Be successfully employed or accepted into a postgraduate program, and demonstrate a pursuit of lifelong learning.
1. Engineering knowledge: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

2. Problem analysis: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences

3. Design/development of solutions: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

4. Conduct investigations of complex problems: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

5. Modern tool usage: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modelling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

6. The engineer and society: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.

7. Environment and sustainability: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
8. Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
9. Individual and team work: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

10. Communication: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

11. Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
12. Life-long learning: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.
PSO1: Demonstrate the working principles of computing systems and application Software
PSO2: Provide the suitable strategies and design solutions to solve IT related problems.
PSO3: Apply the professional practices to implement and deploy the real life applications.
B.E. in Information Science and Engineering

The students should have passed 2nd PUC / 12th Standard or equivalent examination with English as one of the languages and obtained 45% of marks in aggregate in Physics and Mathematics along with chemistry / Bio-Technology / Computer Science / Electronics / Biology in case of candidates belonging to Karnataka Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes (Category 1, 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B) the minimum marks for the purpose of eligibility will be 40% of marks in aggregate in the optional subjects in the qualifying examination.
Department of Information Science and Engineering

Dr. Bharati Harsoor Professor and Head of the Department awarded with Doctoral Degree by Osmania University, Hyderabad, Telangana for her research dissertation on Mobile Computing under the guidance of Dr. S. Ramachandram, Vice Chancellor, Osmania University, Hyderabad. She completed her Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering from Gulbarga University, Gulbarga and Post-graduation from Visvesvaraya Technological University Belagavi. She has 22 years of teaching experience and her areas of interest are Computer Networks, Software Engineering, Data Analytics, and has published more than 25 research papers in various reputed National and International Journals. At present seven research scholars are pursuing their research under her. She played a prime role in establishing research and IoT laboratories. She involved in the confidential work for NET/SET examination for Telangana and Andhra State.
She organized and chaired many Short Term Training Programs, Faculty Development Programs and Seminars. She worked as a reviewer for National and International Journals, Papers and Book chapters. She was a Program Convener to International Conference on Current Research and Applications in Electrical Science (ICCRAES-16) held in the year 2016.
She is member for Academic Council and Chair-Person for Board of Studies and Board of Examination of PDA College of Engineering, Kalaburagi. She is also the member for many Professional Societies and represents her active involvement in the events by delivering technical lectures and seminars.
Considering her academic excellence she was honoured with Shayesta Akhtar Memorial National Award for Best Women Engineering College Teacher, instituted by Indian Society for Technical Education, New Delhi in the 48th ISTE National Annual Convention Held at Visvesvaraya Technological University, Belagavi on 19th – 20th March, 2019.
She dedicated her professional service towards the welfare of the students and development of the department. She exhibits good governance and lead the team with a vision to meet outcome based education.

The Institute has laid strong emphasis towards generation of resources and active collaboration with funding agencies and R and D organizations. Faculties have involved in sponsored research projects from various funding agencies like KSCST, ITBT-NAIN ((GOK), AICTE (GOI), and VGST (GOK) in the last three years.

The Department has well equipped laboratories with state-of-the-art facilities like servers, workstations, thin clients, mobile terminals, desktops and networking devices. The Department is well equipped with the requisite and latest version Software and state-of-the-art IT infrastructure. All the computing resources are inter-connected with high speed intranet and have Internet connectivity to the outside world. Department has well equipped Class Rooms and Seminar hall for e-learning facility.
8. In-house Training through well qualified Professionals
Apart from College Central Library, Department has well stocked with Books which support Teaching, Learning and Research.

Our faculties have presented and published almost 50+ papers in various National/International Conferences in India and abroad and almost 30+ publications in International Journals.
Most of our faculty members reviewed a research papers for National and International Conferences.
One of our faculty Prof. Uday S. Balagar has been awarded as the Best performer for the academic year 2013-14.
Some of the faculty worked as Resourse persons in many of Short Term Training Programs / Workshops / Seminars
Some of the faculty presented their seminars organized by local bodies.
Five of student’s project got selected for KSCST for academic year 2013-14.
Three of our students cleared their KAS prelims and stepping for their finals.
One of our student participated in zonal round of “RoboTryst – 2014 organized by Robosapiens Technologies Pvt. Ltd., in association with Tryst-2014 at IIT Delhi.
ITBT Government of Karnataka sanctioned rupees three lakhs for the student’s project entitled Smart Water Way
Students have presented many papers in National/International Conferences
Our students have won awards in various competitions and Poster presentations at various inter college level.
Students of the Department have achieved ranks at the University level(VTU) and gold medal at college level.
1. Miss. Ambika Avanti bagged IX rank at VTU Level
2. Miss. Nida Sumayya bagged nine gold medals in second convocation of the college.
3. Miss Trupti of lateral entry bagged gold medal in third convocation of the college.

7. Three Days Industry Institute Interaction Program on “Software Testing and Quality Assurance” sponsored by TEQIP – II and IETE was jointly organized with CSE Dept. from 21st – 23rd March, 2017.

8. Two Days Industry Institute Interaction Program on “Real Time Data Warehousing and Visualization : Tools and Technologies” sponsored by TEQIP – II and IETE, jointly organized with CSE Dept. from 25th – 26th March, 2017.
9. Three Days Industry Institute Interaction Program on “Featuring User Interfaces Using Python” sponsored by TEQIP – II and IETE, jointly organized with CSE Dept. from 24th – 26th March, 2017.
